page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: {Gribbin Head-Housing ____________________ At the Gribbin,the only housing was a farm at Menabilly Barton and a house (which used to be an old boat house) above Polridmouth Beach. The farmhouse was old.It was cream painted.Most of the farmbuildings were made of stone, the newer ones of wood.There was a Silage Barn where they stored the cooked grass. The house at Polridmouth had a big lake beside it which swans were swimming on.Beside it was a big lawn. The house was a grey granite building. {Gribbin Head-Landscape ______________________ There were lots of trees near the house and a path by some fields with cattle in them.Beyond the fields you could mostly see green pasture,cliffs and sea.
